poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Buy your Bombay mix with rupees From the Mumbai mint. Beware of those moustachioed Greek demigods from Gandahar, But script their myths of solitude For Bollywood. Don't miss a trick, so Little Miss Minx can mince in her minks A Bangalore rhythm in workaday pinks, Rings on her mitts, polo mints on her toes, Steak mince and tatties wherever she goes.
